page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY BEULAH -GARTH
page.content: Garth House was home of the Gwynne family by 1642. Sarah Gwynne was married to Charles Wesley by his brother John, at Llanlleonfel Church in 1749. Charles is said to have been inspired to write "Jesu, Lover of my soul" here when a robin flew in seeking shelter during a thunderstorm. Since 1912, the home of the Wilson family. At side of A483 below Llanlleonfel Church is a sulphur spring known as "Billy Wern" once used for medicinal purposes. Caerau Farm, Beulah is on the site of a Roman garrison. Roman pottery has been dug up on the farm. The road to Llangammarch follows a Roman road. There is also an Early British earth- works sited there, and one on Twdyn, Beulah which is better preserved.
